title: Estimating Vehicle Speed on Roadways Using RNNs and Transformers: A Video-based Approach
author: Sai Krishna Reddy Mareddy (Electrical and Computer Engineering Department, University of North Carolina at Charlotte), Dhanush Upplapati (Electrical and Computer Engineering Department, University of North Carolina at Charlotte), Dhanush Kumar Antharam (Electrical and Computer Engineering Department, University of North Carolina at Charlotte), ... , Sai Krishna Reddy Mareddy (Electrical and Computer Engineering Department, University of North Carolina at Charlotte)
relevance_why: The methodologies discussed can inform approaches in audio-visual synchronization, especially in capturing and processing dynamic audio relevant to traffic environments.
background: The project involves estimating vehicle speeds from video data using advanced machine learning models like Recurrent Neural Networks and Transformers.
contribution: This paper introduces the use of LSTM and GRU alongside Transformers to achieve robust video-based vehicle speed estimation, demonstrating improved accuracy compared to traditional methods.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods relied heavily on radar and manual systems for speed estimation but faced limitations such as high costs and poor scalability.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work enhances speed estimation by integrating sequential data processing capabilities of RNNs with the advanced features of Transformers, thereby enabling handling of longer sequences with better context.

key_innovation: The unique combination of advanced machine learning models allows for real-time vehicle speed detection using existing camera infrastructure, enhancing scalability and cost efficiency.
real_world_impact: This approach has the potential to significantly improve road safety and traffic management by providing reliable speed detection systems that leverage existing surveillance setups.

new_terms.Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM): **Long Short-Term Memory** is a type of Recurrent Neural Network (RNN) architecture capable of learning long-term dependencies by using memory cells and gates to control information flow.
new_terms.Gated Recurrent Unit (GRU): **Gated Recurrent Unit** is a variant of LSTM that combines the cell state and hidden state, simplifying the architecture and often providing similar performance with fewer parameters.
new_terms.Transformers: **Transformers** are a type of deep learning model that uses self-attention mechanisms to process sequences in parallel, making them highly effective for tasks such as natural language processing and, as indicated here, video analysis.
